text: Me and my family watch this every Christmas Eve
It was awesome!!!! So glad I got to see this on the big screen, and for only $1!!!
A holiday staple, wall-to-wall laughs. It's a shame Randy Quaid turned into Trump-loving dirtbag IRL, but Cousin Eddie is a quotable muck.

National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation is a holiday comedy that leans fully into slapstick and absurdity, showcasing Chevy Chase at his mischievous, improvisational best. The film embodies the zany, over-the-top humor that the National Lampoon brand is known for, with outrageous situations, physical comedy, and the chaotic trials of family life at the center. Chase’s performance is undoubtedly the highlight — his timing, facial expressions, and willingness to embrace the ridiculousness make the movie genuinely entertaining.

The screenplay hits most of the expected beats of a holiday comedy, from the disastrous family gatherings to the improbable mishaps, like the car going under the Christmas tree truck, which felt particularly clever and practical rather than relying on visual effects. While the story itself isn’t especially deep or memorable, it provides a solid framework for the comedic set pieces and physical gags that drive the film. The director keeps the energy high, and the cast supports Chase well, making the family interactions believable in their chaotic, exaggerated way.

That said, the movie didn’t strike me as the unassailable classic it’s often made out to be. While it delivers laughs and some truly iconic moments, it’s more enjoyable in bursts rather than as a film you’d watch repeatedly for narrative satisfaction. Its humor is broad, and its plot is lightweight, meaning it works best as a casual, feel-good holiday diversion rather than a film of lasting cinematic depth.

Chevy Chase’s contribution elevates the material; his comedic instincts and improvisation bring charm and a sense of fun to even the most absurd situations. Scenes like the Christmas lights disaster or the unexpected encounters with extended family members capture that chaotic holiday spirit while remaining amusingly relatable. The physical comedy is executed well, making the jokes land even decades later.

Overall, Christmas Vacation is a fun, festive movie with enough heart and humor to justify a viewing during the holidays. It’s not a groundbreaking classic, but it remains a serviceable and entertaining example of National Lampoon-style comedy. It’s worth revisiting when it comes on TV or streaming, but I wouldn’t actively seek it out as a must-watch every season.

A frekin classic. The funniest of the entire Vacation series. If you haven't watched this, you live in a shoebox. Break out of that box and laugh at a really good movie. Keep a close look at Cousin Eddy when he and Clark are shopping for Christmas gifts after he picks up a big bag of dog food. Classically hidden yet not so hidden crude humor. Great stuff.
THE funniest Christmas movie of all time. I have seen this movie at least 100 times and it never ceases to make me laugh each and every time
Favorite and best Christmas movie ever!
This is my favorite holiday movie. A hilarious, quotable classic that never gets old
Funniest comedy movie to make you laugh with Christmas in the movie. Funny holiday movie
Chevy Chase is so funny in this movie! Ridiculously funny and captures the Christmas spirit

Top 100 all-time Comedy.

Absolutely unnecessary outside of December 15th-26th.

Watching Clark Griswold’s determined descent into holiday insanity is not only hauntingly familiar to most of us, it makes this movie not only a great holiday movie but also a great movie on its own merits. Randy Quaid’s Cousin Eddie is the one element that really makes it something that you can watch again and again. It’s a rare movie that seems to get funnier the more you watch it.
Christmas Vacation is a Hilarious Holiday classic that should go down as one of the funniest movies out there.
Best xmas movie of all time

While some of the jokes might not have aged very well, the majority of them did! 

This film is going on 40 years old, and has easily cemented itself as one of the all time great Christmas classics during that time span.
This movie was really funny, but I feel like there's something missing to me, especially considering how much other people enjoy this movie. Good for the holiday season.

This movie is a timeless classic that gets ages like wine. Chevy Chase and the rest of the cast just make this movie a perfect classic to watch every year, especially around the holidays. I'm thankful local theaters still play it sometimes around Christmas. How can you not give this a 5 star? I hope this one is around for many years to come!! A perfect comedy!
An absolute Christmas Classic, along with Die Hard and A Christmas Story

'National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation', unlike predecessor 'National Lampoon’s European Vacation', is more akin to the original. A good watch it is, if still off from the first flick. The festive vibes are there, it's perhaps a bit too mean-spirited at times but overall works.

The cast are the cast, I don't think anyone stands out as being a great performer but they are all satisfactory. Chevy Chase is the obvious lead, don't get me wrong, but I wouldn't rank his performance as anything overly higher than his co-stars. Interesting to see Julia Louis-Dreyfus appear, by the way.

All in all, there's enough there to entertain. The ending is suitably watchable, which is something I did feel was missing from the previous film.
